intro: Spiraea camtschatica var. himalensis, commonly known as the Himalayan weeping spirea, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, arching branches that bear clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its foliage is dense and provides attractive autumn color, making it a valued ornamental plant. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, though it can tolerate partial shade.
